of or relating to an
internet company ;

a connection made via the
internet to another website ;

crime committed using a computer and the
internet to steal a person's identity or sell contraband or stalk victims or disrupt operations with malevolent_programs ;

commerce conducted electronically ( as on the
internet ) ;

a cafe whose customers sit at computer terminals and log_on to the
internet while they eat and drink ;

a security_system consisting of a combination of hardware and software that limits the exposure of a computer or computer_network to attack from crackers ; commonly used on local_area_networks that are connected to the
internet ;

a computer_network similar to but separate from the
internet ; devoted to the dissemination of information to and for the Intelligence_Community ;

an extensive electronic_network ( such as the
internet ) used for the rapid transfer of sound and video and graphics in digital form ;

a digital_camera designed to take digital photographs and transmit them over the
internet ;

a document connected to the World_Wide_Web and viewable by anyone connected to the
internet who has a web_browser ;

a computer connected to the
internet that maintains a series of web_pages on the World_Wide_Web ;

a site on the
internet where a number of users can communicate in real_time ( typically one dedicated to a particular topic ) ;

a site that the owner positions as an entrance to other sites on the
internet ;

a computer_program that retrieves documents or files or data from a database or from a computer_network ( especially from the
internet ) ;

a computer_program that prowls the
internet looking_for publicly accessible resources that can be added to a database ; the database can then be searched with a search_engine ;

a protocol developed for the
internet to get data from one network device to another ;

a set of protocols ( including TCP ) developed for the
internet in the 1970s to get data from one network device to another ;

strings of letters and numbers ( separated by periods ) that are used to name organizations and computers and addresses on the
internet ;

a group of like-minded people united by the
internet ; a new kind of social or political of business group that may exert broad influence on a shared concern ;

a company that operates its business primarily on the
internet using a URL that ends in .com ;

a computer_user who uses the
internet ; someone who explores cyberspace ;

internet ;

search the
internet using the Google search_engine ;

distribute over the
